Angeleene "Zemmy" Ang

Electro-optical Engineering PhD student angeleene.ang@gmail.com

Aspiring Physicist. Perpetually curious. Website currently under re-construction.

Scientific Research

Atomic trapping using all-dielectric waveguides

This work presents results from proof-of-concept simulation of an all-dielectric nano-antenna/waveguide system and its potential application for trapping cold atoms.

Atomic trapping using all-dielectric waveguides

Related Publications

  • Tailored optical potentials for Cs atoms above waveguides with focusing dielectric nano-antenna

Conference Presentations

  • Tailored optical potentials for Cs atoms above waveguides with focusing dielectric nano-antenna
  • Design of silicon nano-antenna on optical waveguide with deep learning-based algorithm to trap atoms
  • All-dielectric waveguide-overlayer system for optical trapping of atoms
  • Tailoring the trapping potential for Cesium atoms using nano-antennas of different shapes on a waveguide
  • All-dielectric waveguide-overlayer system for single-atom optical trapping

Photonic Hook for Nano-manipulation

This paper investigates the movement of nanoparticles under the influence of a curved electric field generated by an asymmetric dielectric cuboid.

Photonic Hook for Nano-manipulation

Related Publications

  • Photonic hook formation in near-infrared with MXene Ti3C2 nanoparticles
  • Temperature mediated ‘Photonic hook’ nanoparticle manipulator with pulsed illumination
  • ‘Photonic Hook’ based optomechanical nanoparticle manipulator

Conference Presentations

  • Low-contrast photonic hook manipulator for cellular differentiation

Scattering Forces from Photonic Crystals

This paper presents a study of several periodic nanostructures, their capability to generate a specialized electric field, and the movement of nanoparticles under the influence of this field

Scattering Forces from Photonic Crystals

Related Publications

  • Scattering Forces within a Left-Handed Photonic Crystal

Conference Presentations

  • Electromagnetic forces in negatively refracting photonic crystals
  • Electromagnetic Forces in Negatively Refracting Photonic Crystals

Optical Fiber Skey Ray Tracing

This work shows a purely analytical method for calculating the skew 3D light rays confined inside an optical fiber.

Optical Fiber Skey Ray Tracing

Related Publications

  • Skew ray tracing in a step-index optical fiber using geometric algebra

Gravitational orbits of the higher-order multipole moments

This thesis expands the Kepler problem of graviational orbits by considering the additional multipole moments of a non-spherically symmetric attractor

Gravitational orbits of the higher-order multipole moments
